title: Saint Croix National Scenic Riverway: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things to Do       The St. Croix and Namekagon rivers, known for their pristine, clean water, and outstanding opportunities to paddle, fish, and camp, will surprise you with their diversity. Get to know the Riverway in your own way.    Â      Explore the Riverway           Paddle the Rivers   See some of the least developed country in the Midwest by paddling your own equipment or rent some.          Outstanding Fishery   Smallmouth bass, trout, and muskies are a few of the fish that bring anglers from far and wide. Fishing guides can help.          Hundreds of Riverside Campsites Camp Beside a River   Camp at riverside sites along your multi-day paddle or stay a few nights in a walk-in site.          River Boating   Whether you are fishing or enjoying the scenery, boating is a rewarding way to experience the river.          Local & National Trails Hike Along the River   Hike along two rivers or start a 1000 mile journey across Wisconsin.          Discover the River  Ranger-led Programs   Join park rangers on boats, in kayaks, with nets, and beside the river for engaging and fun programs for all.
